data.enText: to sit on your heels with your knees bent up close to your body

data.chText: 偷住，擅自占用（房子或地方）
data.enText: to live in a building or on land which is not yours, without the owner's permission

data.chText: 他们落得在牛津路偷住空房的境地。
data.enText: They ended up squatting in the empty houses on Oxford Road.
a building that people are living in without permission and without paying rent

data.chText: 擅自住在他人空着的房子里

data.enText: a squatting position of the body
short and wide or fat, in a way that is not attractive
a squat muscular man with a shaven head

means: 偷住，擅自占用(房子或地方)

tr: the act of assuming or maintaining a crouching position with the knees bent and the buttocks near the heels
exercising by repeatedly assuming a crouching position with the knees bent

example: In some cultures, the women give birth while squatting
The children hunkered down to protect themselves from the sandstorm

tr: be close to the earth, or be disproportionately wide
having a low center of gravity
as e.g. having short legs and heavy musculature
example: some people seem born to be square and chunky
a dumpy little dumpling of a woman
dachshunds are long lowset dogs with drooping ears
a little church with a squat tower

value.def: If you squat, you lower yourself towards the ground, balancing on your feet with your legs bent.

example.ex: He squatted, grunting at the pain in his knees...
example.tran: 他蹲在那儿，双膝的伤痛得他直哼哼。

example.ex: We squatted beside the pool and watched the diver sink slowly down...
example.tran: 我们蹲在水池旁，看着潜水者慢慢沉下水。

example.ex: He came over and squatted on his heels, looking up at the boys.
example.tran: 他走过来，蹲下身，抬头看着这些男孩。

example.ex: Albert squatted down and examined it...
example.tran: 阿尔伯特蹲下来仔细查看它。

example.ex: She had squatted down on her heels.
He bent to a squat and gathered the puppies on his lap.
example.tran: 他弯腰蹲下，把小狗们都抱到自己腿上。

value.def: If you describe someone or something as squat, you mean they are short and thick, usually in an unattractive way.

example.ex: Eddie was a short squat fellow in his forties with thinning hair.
example.tran: 埃迪四十多岁，矮矮胖胖的，头发日渐稀疏。

value.def: People who squat occupy an unused building or unused land without having a legal right to do so.

example.ex: You can't simply wander around squatting on other people's property...
example.tran: 你不能这样到处乱窜，擅自占用别人的地产。

example.ex: They earn their living by squatting the land and sharecropping.
example.tran: 他们靠擅自占用土地，按种地的收益分成为生。

value.tran: 擅自占用(闲置房屋或土地)

value.def: A squat is an empty building that people are living in illegally, without paying any rent or any property tax.

example.ex: After returning from Paris, David moved to a squat in Brixton...
example.tran: 从巴黎回来后，戴维搬进了布里克斯顿的一座空房里住下了。

example.ex: Thomas now faces eviction from his squat.
example.tran: 托马斯现在要被从他占住的房子里驱赶出来。
